Docs.summary: Represents a static constructor for a class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeTypeConstructor> can be used to represent the static constructor for a class. A static constructor is called once when the type is loaded.
> [!NOTE] > Not all languages support static constructors. Support for static constructors can be checked by calling <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.ICodeGenerator.Supports%2A> with the <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.GeneratorSupport.StaticConstructors> flag to determine if static constructors are supported by the code generator for a particular language.
## Examples The following example demonstrates use of a <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeTypeConstructor> to declare a static constructor for a type.
